title: Is this the list of federal employees whom Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy may fire? Here's the truth
content: Several lists of federal employees are going viral with X users claiming that these staff are drawing huge salaries from the government. Elon Musk shared a few and commented on them triggering fear that those individuals will be the first to be fired from their jobs. The Department of Government Efficiency has not put out any list and Vivek Ramaswamy said DOGE's opponent is bureaucracy, not an individual. But Elon Musk sharing posts containing individual names spread panic among employees.
summary: Several lists of federal employees are going viral with X users claiming that these staff are drawing huge salaries from the government. Elon Musk shared a few and commented on them triggering fear that those individuals will be the first to be fired from their jobs. The Department of Government Efficiency has not put out any list and Vivek Ramaswamy said DOGE's opponent is bureaucracy, not an individual. But Elon Musk sharing posts containing individual names spread panic among employees.

title: Kamala Harris adviser's explosive claim: Internal polling never showed VP leading Trump
content: Kamala Harris's senior campaign adviser, David Plouffe, revealed on a podcast that internal polling never showed Harris ahead of Trump, contradicting public polls. Plouffe admitted the campaign struggled to differentiate Harris from Biden and faced an uphill battle in key demographics. ​“We were behind. I mean, I think it surprised people because there were these public polls that came out in late September, early October, showing us with leads that we never saw,” Plouffe said.
summary: Kamala Harris's senior campaign adviser, David Plouffe, revealed on a podcast that internal polling never showed Harris ahead of Trump, contradicting public polls. Plouffe admitted the campaign struggled to differentiate Harris from Biden and faced an uphill battle in key demographics. ​“We were behind. I mean, I think it surprised people because there were these public polls that came out in late September, early October, showing us with leads that we never saw,” Plouffe said.

title: 'Pregnant for 15 months': All you need to know about Nigeria's 'cryptic pregnancy' scam
content: A disturbing "cryptic pregnancy" scam in Nigeria preys on infertile women. Scammers posing as medical professionals administer fake treatments, leading victims to believe in phantom pregnancies. The scam culminates in the delivery of trafficked babies, purchased for exorbitant fees. Authorities are working to dismantle these operations and rescue victims.
summary: A disturbing "cryptic pregnancy" scam in Nigeria preys on infertile women. Scammers posing as medical professionals administer fake treatments, leading victims to believe in phantom pregnancies.  The scam culminates in the delivery of trafficked babies, purchased for exorbitant fees. Authorities are working to dismantle these operations and rescue victims.

title: Chinese man discovers 20-year-old dice lodged in nose after experiencing chronic sneezing
content: A 23-year-old Chinese man, Xiaoma, recently discovered the source of his chronic nasal issues: a dice lodged in his nasal cavity for two decades. Doctors successfully removed the partially corroded dice, which Xiaoma believes he inhaled as a toddler. This incident highlights the dangers of foreign objects in nasal passages and the importance of parental vigilance, prompting widespread concern online.
summary: A 23-year-old Chinese man, Xiaoma, recently discovered the source of his chronic nasal issues: a dice lodged in his nasal cavity for two decades.  Doctors successfully removed the partially corroded dice, which Xiaoma believes he inhaled as a toddler.  This incident highlights the dangers of foreign objects in nasal passages and the importance of parental vigilance, prompting widespread concern online.

title: Donald Trump's cabinet picks targeted with bomb threats and 'swatting'
content: Several members of President-elect Donald Trump's administration and cabinet picks were targeted with bomb threats and "swatting" incidents late Tuesday and early Wednesday. Trump's spokesperson, Karoline Leavitt, confirmed the threats, emphasizing that such intimidation tactics will not be a deterrent. These incidents follow previous threats and attempted assassination attempts against Trump earlier this year.
summary: Several members of President-elect Donald Trump's administration and cabinet picks were targeted with bomb threats and "swatting" incidents late Tuesday and early Wednesday.  Trump's spokesperson, Karoline Leavitt, confirmed the threats, emphasizing that such intimidation tactics will not be a deterrent.  These incidents follow previous threats and attempted assassination attempts against Trump earlier this year.

title: Israel appeals to suspend ICC warrant against PM Netanyahu
content: Israel has requested the International Criminal Court (ICC) to suspend arrest warrants issued for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and former Defense Minister Yoav Gallant. They are accused of war crimes and crimes against humanity related to the 2023 Gaza war, including intentionally depriving civilians of essential supplies. Israel disputes the ICC's jurisdiction and claims bias.
summary: Israel has requested the International Criminal Court (ICC) to suspend arrest warrants issued for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and former Defense Minister Yoav Gallant.  They are accused of war crimes and crimes against humanity related to the 2023 Gaza war, including intentionally depriving civilians of essential supplies. Israel disputes the ICC's jurisdiction and claims bias.

title: US urges Ukraine to lower fighting age to 18 to mobilise new soldiers
content: The US has urged Ukraine to lower its soldier age limit to 18, believing Kyiv hasn't mobilized sufficient troops. Tensions escalated as Ukraine used Western missiles to strike inside Russia for the first time. Russia responded with a hypersonic missile launch, warning against further Western involvement.
summary: The US has urged Ukraine to lower its soldier age limit to 18, believing Kyiv hasn't mobilized sufficient troops.  Tensions escalated as Ukraine used Western missiles to strike inside Russia for the first time. Russia responded with a hypersonic missile launch, warning against further Western involvement.

title: Harvey Weinstein kept in dirty underwear, blood-spattered clothes in gulag-like jail, allege lawyers
content: Harvey Weinstein's lawyers claimed he's receiving inadequate medical care at Rikers Island, citing unsanitary conditions and untreated medical issues. They've filed a $5 million claim alleging premature returns to jail after hospitalizations. “When I last visited him, I found him with blood spatter on his prison garb, possibly from IV’s, clothes that had not been washed for weeks," his attorney said.
summary: Harvey Weinstein's lawyers claimed he's receiving inadequate medical care at Rikers Island, citing unsanitary conditions and untreated medical issues.  They've filed a $5 million claim alleging premature returns to jail after hospitalizations.  “When I last visited him, I found him with blood spatter on his prison garb, possibly from IV’s, clothes that had not been washed for weeks," his attorney said.

title: Biden govt mulls over $680 million arms sale to Israel: Report
content: The Biden administration is moving forward with a $680 million arms sale to Israel, encompassing JDAM kits and small-diameter bombs. This follows a US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon, and as the US pushes for a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release. A larger $20 billion arms package for Israel, including F-15 fighter jets, was approved in August.
summary: The Biden administration is moving forward with a $680 million arms sale to Israel, encompassing JDAM kits and small-diameter bombs. This follows a US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon, and as the US pushes for a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release.  A larger $20 billion arms package for Israel, including F-15 fighter jets, was approved in August.

title: Mesmerizing display of light pillars illuminates Central Alberta sky
Pakistan: Three more deaths in Kurram clashes take toll to 76
content: The death toll from week-long clashes in Kurram district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, has risen to 76 after retaliatory attacks claimed three more lives. Despite a ceasefire, sporadic fighting continues, with helicopter attacks reported. Medicine shortages worsen the crisis as road closures hinder supplies, leaving civilians trapped in escalating violence.
summary: The death toll from week-long clashes in Kurram district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, has risen to 76 after retaliatory attacks claimed three more lives. Despite a ceasefire, sporadic fighting continues, with helicopter attacks reported.  Medicine shortages worsen the crisis as road closures hinder supplies, leaving civilians trapped in escalating violence.

title: Randy Fine's 'bombs away' threat to Muslim Congresswomen Ilhan Omar, Rashida Tlaib
content: Florida State Senator Randy Fine, a Republican and staunch supporter of Israel, who is running for Congress from Mike Waltz's seat openly threatened Muslim Congresswomen Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar on X, using inflammatory language and anti-Muslim rhetoric. Fine has been endorsed by President-elect Trump. He previously made controversial remarks about a Jewish constituent and a Turkish American activist killed by Israeli forces.
summary: Florida State Senator Randy Fine, a Republican and staunch supporter of Israel, who is running for Congress from Mike Waltz's seat openly threatened Muslim Congresswomen Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar on X, using inflammatory language and anti-Muslim rhetoric.  Fine has been endorsed by President-elect Trump.  He previously made controversial remarks about a Jewish constituent and a Turkish American activist killed by Israeli forces.

title: Russia asks 2 German journalist to leave in 'tit-for-tat' move
content: Russia revoked the accreditation of two German ARD journalists, ordering their departure. Moscow framed this as retaliation for Germany's alleged targeting of two Russian state TV journalists. Germany denied shutting down Channel One's office, clarifying that the issue pertained to residence status, handled independently by state authorities.
summary: Russia revoked the accreditation of two German ARD journalists, ordering their departure. Moscow framed this as retaliation for Germany's alleged targeting of two Russian state TV journalists. Germany denied shutting down Channel One's office, clarifying that the issue pertained to residence status, handled independently by state authorities.

title: US slaps sanctions on 21 top Venezuela officials over election fraud
content: The United States imposed sanctions on 21 Venezuelan officials following President Maduro's contested reelection. The sanctions target those involved in the crackdown on the opposition after the election, which the US believes didn't reflect the will of the Venezuelan people. The US expressed concerns over the election's accuracy and called for a transparent review of the results.
summary: The United States imposed sanctions on 21 Venezuelan officials following President Maduro's contested reelection.  The sanctions target those involved in the crackdown on the opposition after the election, which the US believes didn't reflect the will of the Venezuelan people.  The US expressed concerns over the election's accuracy and called for a transparent review of the results.

title: Did RFK jr claim heroin made him a class topper? Here's the actual fact
content: ​"I was at the bottom of my class. I started doing heroin, and I went to the top of my class. Suddenly I could sit still, and I could read and I could concentrate. I could listen to what people were saying," Kennedy Jr said in a July video which is now doing the rounds after he was nominated as the health secretary of the incoming Donald Trump administration.
summary: ​"I was at the bottom of my class. I started doing heroin, and I went to the top of my class. Suddenly I could sit still, and I could read and I could concentrate. I could listen to what people were saying," Kennedy Jr said in a July video which is now doing the rounds after he was nominated as the health secretary of the incoming Donald Trump administration.

title: Massachusetts farmers anticipate record cranberry harvest despite climate challenges
content: Massachusetts cranberry farmers are experiencing a bountiful harvest this year, with projections exceeding 2 million barrels. Steve Ward, a local grower, anticipates his best yield in three years despite challenges like hot weather and dry spells impacting cranberry plants. While the industry faces historical hurdles such as trade wars and fluctuating prices, farmers are innovating with solar energy solutions.
summary: Massachusetts cranberry farmers are experiencing a bountiful harvest this year, with projections exceeding 2 million barrels. Steve Ward, a local grower, anticipates his best yield in three years despite challenges like hot weather and dry spells impacting cranberry plants. While the industry faces historical hurdles such as trade wars and fluctuating prices, farmers are innovating with solar energy solutions.

title: Does DEI training make people 'anti-Hindu'? What you ought to know
content: A study by the Network Contagion Research Institute (NCRI) and Rutgers University highlights unintended consequences of caste-based Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) programs by Equality Labs. It found that such training exacerbates anti-Hindu bias, fosters divisive rhetoric, and increases perceptions of systemic injustice.
summary: A study by the Network Contagion Research Institute (NCRI) and Rutgers University highlights unintended consequences of caste-based Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) programs by Equality Labs. It found that such training exacerbates anti-Hindu bias, fosters divisive rhetoric, and increases perceptions of systemic injustice.

title: USA Facing Bankruptcy: Why every American is already $100,000 in debt
content: As debt climbs, the US government is spending over $1 billion daily on interest payments alone. This year, servicing the debt is expected to exceed $1 trillion—more than what is allocated for national defence. Rising interest rates compound the problem, increasing borrowing costs for both the government and ordinary citizens.Shai Akabas, from the Bipartisan Policy Center, explained: “The current level of debt is driving up interest rates, including mortgages, and raising living costs for households. This will dampen economic growth and reduce opportunities for future generations.”
summary: As debt climbs, the US government is spending over $1 billion daily on interest payments alone. This year, servicing the debt is expected to exceed $1 trillion—more than what is allocated for national defence. Rising interest rates compound the problem, increasing borrowing costs for both the government and ordinary citizens.Shai Akabas, from the Bipartisan Policy Center, explained: “The current level of debt is driving up interest rates, including mortgages, and raising living costs for households. This will dampen economic growth and reduce opportunities for future generations.”

title: New twist in DB Cooper Case: Was DB Cooper actually Richard McCoy?
content: Fast forward to 2023, when Chanté and Rick claimed that their father was the elusive hijacker. They waited until their mother’s death in 2020 to share their story, citing fears that she could be implicated due to evidence allegedly linking her to the crime. Among the items they revealed was a parachute that Rick claimed was “one in a billion” and matched the rig prepared by skydiving expert Earl Cossey, who had modified the parachutes for Cooper. The parachute was reportedly found in their mother’s storage outside the family home.
summary: Fast forward to 2023, when Chanté and Rick claimed that their father was the elusive hijacker. They waited until their mother’s death in 2020 to share their story, citing fears that she could be implicated due to evidence allegedly linking her to the crime. Among the items they revealed was a parachute that Rick claimed was “one in a billion” and matched the rig prepared by skydiving expert Earl Cossey, who had modified the parachutes for Cooper. The parachute was reportedly found in their mother’s storage outside the family home.

title: Jimmy Kimmel jokes Trump's 25% tariff is dumbest idea he's come up with since Don Jr
content: Jimmy Kimmel mocked Donald Trump's proposed 25% tariff on Mexican and Canadian imports, calling it his "dumbest idea." Kimmel said the tariff will send inflation through the roof because it's not Mexico, Canada, China that pay the taxes but the American companies that import their products pay the taxes making avocados $40.
summary: Jimmy Kimmel mocked Donald Trump's proposed 25% tariff on Mexican and Canadian imports, calling it his "dumbest idea."  Kimmel said the tariff will send inflation through the roof because it's not Mexico, Canada, China that pay the taxes but the American companies that import their products pay the taxes making avocados $40.
